metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15594 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
arch/x86/kernel/paravirt.c in the Linux kernel before 4.18.1 mishandlescertain indirect calls, which makes it easier for attackers to conductSpectre-v2 attacks against paravirtual guests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-137.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-137.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-137.163
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1098-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1098.106
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1102.107
No subscription required
